intro: Baroniella linearis, commonly known as the slender baroniella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and attract pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. Baroniella linearis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
